channel.title: WoodnFab — Projects, Tools & Knowledge on Wood 'n Fab
channel.description: Recent content in WoodnFab — Projects, Tools & Knowledge on Wood 'n Fab

item.title: Rootanika
item.description:
Rootanika

Rootanika is a fusion project between the open-source CNC machines of Root CNC and Mekanika CNC. The goal is to combine the best of both worlds into a modular, accessible, and powerful CNC machine for makers, hobbyists, and small workshops.

Project Goals

  • Combine the rigidity and strength of Root CNC with the user-friendly design and clean aesthetics of Mekanika CNC.
  • Design a fully customizable, belt-driven machine with a focus on reusable and accessible components.
  • Keep the target cost around €800 (excluding spindle and spoilboard), making it affordable without compromising performance.
  • Document everything open-source following the principles of both original projects.

Licensing

Rootanika follows the Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 4.0 license, same as its sources. This means:

item.title: 2025-08-04 – Blender AI
item.description:
Introduction

I’m exploring ways to model my ideas for a CNC machine.
While searching, I came across this video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x60zHw_z4NM

It introduces an interesting workflow that combines ChatGPT with Blender.

To start experimenting, I want to see if we can model a base frame using 30‑series aluminium profiles.

For additional Blender inspiration, I also found this tutorial:
https://www.rab3d.com/tut_blender.php

Hopefully, the creator will continue to update his progress on this approach.

item.title: 2025-08-05 – CNC Related
item.description:
A quick look at some CNC-related content I explored today.

🔥 YouTube – DIY CNC: Your Questions Answered (and What I’d Do Differently)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nlWXileUSbU

This is a follow-up to the first video about my DIY CNC router. Here I answer some of the frequently asked questions I received in the comments on that video. If you have any additional questions, let me know!

In question 5, I talk about the bits I like to use. My main choices are:

item.title: 2025-08-04 – CNC Related
item.description:
A quick look at some CNC-related content I explored today.

🔥 YouTube – £150 CNC Plasma Table Build – Easy, Quick and Cost Effective

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xVZZfx9KPlc

Next-level metal cutting.
I especially liked the use of a tablet and the clear G-code explanation.

🖨️ YouTube – TopsCNC Heavy – The Big 3D Printed CNC DIY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wIgIz47WK7Y

Nice printed CNC and a great build video.
Good for design inspiration.

item.title: 2025-08-03 – CNC Related
item.description:
A quick look at some CNC-related content I explored today.

📊 RootCNC – Overall Average Costs for Complete Builds (Ready to Run)

Discussion on RootCNC Discourse
https://rootcnc.discourse.group/t/overall-average-costs-for-complete-builds-ready-to-run/216

but here is a rough costing for the machines:
4 ~£1200 but mine is a considerably larger machine so saving can be made here!
4 Lite £450-550
3 Lite £450-530
3 Unsure its been a while
Root 2 is not recommended as the newer machine out perform it.

item.title: 2025-08-02 – CNC Related
item.description:
A quick look at some interesting CNC-related content I explored today.

📺 YouTube – OpenBuilds LEAD 1515 Electronics & Software (Using BlackBox)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xxyA5WftF8k

A detailed build video covering the OpenBuilds LEAD 1515, with a focus on electronics, wiring, and software setup using the BlackBox controller.
A solid reference if you’re planning a similar build or want to understand the workflow from assembly to operation.

item.title: 2025-07-29 – CNC Related
item.description:
An overview of interesting CNC-related links I explored today.

📺 Youtube - The Ultimate OneFinity CNC Setup - Spoilboard, Cart, Vertical Table - 400

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dvur03ZA3vU

Create description on make a table, spoilboard and fence

📺 Youtube - Stainless OX CNC work surface and spoil board

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Inl28tvREKU

How I made the work surface and spoil board for my DIY Stainless OX CNC machine. Design in Sketchup and generation of G-code using CamBam and finally cutting the parts on the Stainless OX. For more info check: https://forum.makersupplies.dk/listin…

item.title: 2025-07-27 – CNC Related
item.description:
An overview of interesting CNC-related links I explored today.

📺 YouTube – Riesen DIY CNC Fräse mit 1000x2000mm mit V-Slot Profilen für unter 700€ bauen

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EuOvwwP2x9A

Aufbau und Funktion meiner riesigen #diy #cnc für Holzprojekte aus V-Slot Profilen. Powered by Estlcam, Arduino UNO und CNC Shield.

A large-scale DIY CNC router made with V-slot profiles, driven by Estlcam and Arduino. Very affordable setup under €700.

📺 YouTube – Die Open Source Fräse: Das Endchen

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FVFT421XhG4

item.title: 2025-07-26 - CNC Related
item.description:
An overview of interesting links from today.

Website – CNC Workflow Using CNCjs

https://makerhardware.net/knowledge-base/how-to-guides/cnc-workflow-using-cncjs/

A helpful tutorial on using CNCjs for engraving.

YouTube – How to Build a Large CNC Router (Arduino GRBL + UGS)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DF_1bY8aJbc

A great build video showing how to create a large CNC router using an Arduino, GRBL, and Universal G-Code Sender (UGS).

Highlighted comment:

As somebody about to undertake building my own CNC router, this is the best video that breaks down the basic component design of the table. Mine will be different but this paints such a good picture for a starting point. Excellent work.

item.title: 2025-07-26 - MPCNC related
item.description:
An overview of interesting links from today.

Verkabelung und Steuerung der MPCNC: Eine Schritt-für-Schritt-Anleitung

https://konstruktionsbude.de/mpcnc-verkabelung-steuerung/

A German page detailing the control of an MPCNC using an Arduino-based setup.

Also additional information on the MPCNC:

  • https://konstruktionsbude.de/mpcnc-primo/
  • https://konstruktionsbude.de/mpcnc-primo-einkaufsliste/

MPCNC Part 3

https://coeleveld.com/mpcnc-part-3/

Build description of an MPCNC.

MPCNC Primo – aktuelle Einkaufsliste für Deutschland 2025

https://www.frag-matze.de/heimwerken-mpcnc-primo-2020-teileliste-einkaufsliste-deutsch-deutschland

A current (2025) parts list for the MPCNC in Germany.

German supplier of MPCNC parts

https://www.hoerr-edelstahl.de/Restposten-Schnaeppchen-sonstige-Artikel/Rohr-Set-25-mm-Edelstahl-fuer-PRIMO-mostly-printed-MPCNC-Stangen-Arbeitsbereich.html

item.title: 2025-07-25 - Rascal CNC
item.description:
While browsing the web for information about ROOT CNC, I came across an intriguing CNC design:

Rascal CNC

The Rascal CNC is a hobby grade CNC machine designed BY the Community FOR the Community with the simple goal of being able to cut foam board airplanes.

Here are just a few benefits of owning a Rascal.

Most capable machine for the cost (under $500 USD) For the cost you won’t find a better suited machine to cut foam board and lite ply on its 30x30" (76cm) cut bed.

item.title: My ROOT CNC
item.description:
I recently bought a used ROOT CNC machine on the local marketplace.
It needs some repairs — a few parts are broken — and it looks like the previous owner made some modifications.

This memo is a place to collect reference links and notes related to this machine.

🧩 3D Printed Parts

📌 Z-Carriage System for ROOT 3 CNC (or similar machines)

Thingiverse – Carriage Z System for 52mm & 65mm Spindle (in progress)
